data.title: Obituary for David Earle Robbins
data.meta_description: David Robbins | Passed away on Feb 12, 2022 | David Earle Robbins, age 70 of Whitesville, NY,... Learn More
data.meta_site_name: Obituary for David Earle Robbins | Kenyon Funeral Home
data.text:
David Earle Robbins, age 70 of Whitesville, NY, formerly of Knoxville, PA passed away at Robert Packer Hospital in Sayre on Saturday, February 12, 2022. David, the eldest of three children was born on July 16, 1951 in Wellsboro, the son of the late Burr and Eleanor (Chapin) Robbins. He was a 1969 graduate of Cowanesque Valley High School and graduate with a degree in Agriculture Production from Alfred State College, SUNY in 1972. David worked as a foreman, heavy equipment operator and community relations liaison for the PA Department of Transportation (PennDOT) until retirement in 2012. He achieved the rank of Eagle Scout in Knoxville Troop 22 in 1969. He later served as an assistant scoutmaster and scoutmaster for the troop. In high school, David was very active in FFA and held several offices, including President in his senior year. In 1968 David was recognized at the State Convention as a PA FFA Keystone Farmer. On May 21, 2004 he married Jacqueline (Cramer) Hixson who survives. David is survived by his loving wife, Jackie; brother, Earle (Eileen) Robbins of Knoxville; sister, Barbara Cobb of Ulysses; sons, Adam (Jackie) Robbins and their son, Burr of Sabinsville, Stacey (Stephanie) Moore of Liberty Hill, TX, Shawn (Peggy) Moore of Tioga, PA and Michael Hixson of Whitesville, NY; daughters, Pam Bradford, Rhonda Bradford, Terry (Ray) Outman all of Whitseville, NY and Heather (Rick) Campbell of Greenwood, NY; niece, Meredith (Nick) Heroux of Alaska; nephew, David (Alaina) Cobb of Pittsburgh and several grandchildren. He loved camping, hunting, fishing and gardening and spent summers after retirement camping and visiting with family and friends on the shores of Pine Creek at Crooked Creek Campground in Gaines. He and Jackie also loved fishing trips to the Poplars, Newboro Lake, Canada a venture that they did each spring and fall with their good friends Brian and Cheryl Edgcomb. One of the highlights of David’s life was harvesting an 8 point buck at the age of 10 on the family farm in Knoxville. David was active in the community and was a member of the Knoxville Deerfield Fire Dept, Howard Lines VFW Post, Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation - PA Grand Canyon Chapter; National Rifle Association and life member of Board of Directors for the Baker Foundation. Family will receive friends at Kenyon Funeral Home, 222 W. Main St., Westfield on Friday, 4:00 – 7:00PM and Saturday, 10:00AM – 12:00 PM. A memorial service will be held immediately following at Saturday, 12:00PM with Brian Edgcomb officiating. The family respectfully asks that donations be made to the Hillman Cancer Clinic, 15 Meade St., Wellsboro, PA 16901. www.kenyonfuneralhome.com.
